author: Special Correspondent
text:
They also want State to ensure barrier-free environments throughout

Four disability rights groups together staged a protest at Chepauk on Monday, asking the government to meet a number of their demands. About 700 gathered for the protest, said C. Manoharan, project director, National Federation of the Blind, one of the groups involved.

Among the demands of the groups are: those with over 40 per cent disabilities and who have the government ID card should be given financial assistance by the government. The groups also want the assistance amount to be increased to Rs. 5,000 and for the clause restricting assistance to those who are destitute to be removed, he said.

“We also want the State to ensure barrier-free environments throughout.

The government should set aside funds for this. Also, 100 houses should be given to the disabled under different housing schemes and these should be in places where there is adequate transport,” he said.This apart, the 3 per cent job reservation rule should be followed with a committee that is headed by a High Court judge and has members of the disabled community as members, he said.
title: Disability rights groups protest seeking assistance
